intro: Dipteracanthus longiflorus, commonly known as the long-flowered dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated margin. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
